file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 34-62-02-04 - (145) FMS (UNIVERSAL) CONTROL DISPLAY UNIT / (135) DUAL FMS CDUS - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (145) FMS (UNIVERSAL) CONTROL DISPLAY UNIT / (135) DUAL FMS CDUs - REMOVAL/ INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH FMS UNIVERSAL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the control display unit (CDU) of the Flight Management System (FMS). B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY AIRCRAFT WITH FMS DUAL FMS CONTROL DISPLAY UNIT 34-62-02-000-801-A UNIVERSAL (CDU) 1/2 - REMOVAL AIRCRAFT WITH FMS DUAL FMS CONTROL DISPLAY UNIT 34-62-02-400-801-A UNIVERSAL (CDU) 1/2 - INSTALLATION AIRCRAFT WITH FMS SINGLE FMS CONTROL DISPLAY UNIT 34-62-02-000-802-A UNIVERSAL (CDU) - REMOVAL AIRCRAFT WITH FMS SINGLE FMS CONTROL DISPLAY UNIT 34-62-02-400-802-A UNIVERSAL (CDU) - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 34-62-02 Page 1 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 34-62-02-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH FMS UNIVERSAL 2. DUAL FMS CONTROL DISPLAY UNIT (CDU) 1/2 - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove control display unit (CDU) 1/2 of the Dual Flight Management System (FMS). B. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 223 Cockpit 224 Cockpit C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable E. Consumable Materials Not Applicable F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit H. Preparation SUBTASK 841-005-A (1) On the Circuit Breaker Panel, open the FMS 1/2 circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to it. I. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-005-A (1) Unlock the four dzus fasteners (4) which attach control display unit (CDU) 1/2 (1) to the control pedestal (3). (2) Carefully pull control display unit (CDU) 1/2 (1) to get access to the electrical connector (2). (3) Disconnect the electrical connector (2). (4) Remove control display unit (CDU) 1/2 (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 34-62-02 Page 2 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH FMS UNIVERSAL Dual FMS Control Display Unit (CDU) 1/2 - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONES 223 224 2 DET. A 1 DET. A B B 1. CONTROL DISPLAY UNIT (CDU) 4. DZUS (4) 3. CONTROL PEDESTAL DET. B 2. ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR 1 AIRCRAFT WITH FMS CDUS INSTALLED ON CONTROL PEDESTAL AFT PANEL. 2 AIRCRAFT WITH FMS CDUS INSTALLED ON CONTROL PEDESTAL FORWARD PANEL. 145AMM340242.MCE B EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 34-62-02 Page 3 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 34-62-02-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH FMS UNIVERSAL 3. DUAL FMS CONTROL DISPLAY UNIT (CDU) 1/2 - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install control display unit (CDU) 1/2 of the Dual Flight Management System (FMS). B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 34-62-00-700-801-A/500 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 223 Cockpit 224 Cockpit D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-005-A (1) Connect the electrical connector (2) to control display unit (CDU) 1/2 (1). (2) Put control display unit (CDU) 1/2 (1) in the control pedestal (3). (3) Lock the four dzus fasteners (4). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-005-A (1) On the Circuit Breaker Panel, close the FMS 1/2 circuit breaker and remove the DO- NOT-CLOSE tag from it. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 34-62-02 Page 4 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Do the Dual FMS Operational Test (AMM TASK 34-62-00-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 34-62-02 Page 5 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 34-62-02-000-802-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH FMS UNIVERSAL 4. SINGLE FMS CONTROL DISPLAY UNIT (CDU) - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the control display unit (CDU) of the Flight Management System (FMS). B. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 223 Cockpit 224 Cockpit C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable E. Consumable Materials Not Applicable F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit H. Preparation SUBTASK 841-006-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the FMS 1 circuit breaker (Location Tip: DC BUS 1/NAV/FMS1) and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to it. I. Removal (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-006-A (1) Unlock the four dzus fasteners (4) which attach the control display unit (CDU) (1) to the control pedestal (3). (2) Carefully pull the control display unit (CDU) (1) to get access to the electrical connector (2). (3) Disconnect the electrical connector (2). (4) Remove control display unit (CDU) (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 34-62-02 Page 6 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH FMS UNIVERSAL Single FMS Control Display Unit (CDU) - Removal/Installation Figure 402 A ZONES 223 224 DET. A B 1. CONTROL DISPLAY UNIT (CDU) 4. DZUS (4) 3. CONTROL PEDESTAL DET. B 2. ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR 145AMM340302.MCE A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 34-62-02 Page 7 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 34-62-02-400-802-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH FMS UNIVERSAL 5. SINGLE FMS CONTROL DISPLAY UNIT (CDU) - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the control display unit (CDU) of the Flight Management System (FMS). B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 34-62-00-700-802-A/500 SINGLE FMS - OPERATIONAL TEST C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 223 Cockpit 224 Cockpit D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit I. Installation (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-006-A (1) Connect the electrical connector (2) to the control display unit (CDU) (1). (2) Put the control display unit (CDU) (1) in the control pedestal (3). (3) Lock the four dzus fasteners (4). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-006-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, close the FMS 1 circuit breaker (Location Tip: DC BUS 1/NAV/FMS1) and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from it. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 34-62-02 Page 8 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Do the Single FMS Operational Test ( AMM TASK 34-62-00-700-802-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 34-62-02 Page 9 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
